alert.note: Alert for Northern Outer Banks (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued December 10 at 3:55AM EST until December 11 at 8:00AM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 8 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Up to one half foot of inundation above ground level expected in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Roanoke Island and soundside areas from Oregon Inlet through Kitty Hawk. * WHEN...From 1 AM to 8 AM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Up to 1 to 2 feet of inundation above ground level is possible in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways resulting in a low threat of property damage. Minor inundation of NC 12 near the Oregon Inlet Fishing Center and near Downtown Manteo and causeways on Roanoke Island are possible. Some other roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns, and homes adjacent to the waterfront will experience shallow flooding as well. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Water levels will rise very rapidly as a very strong cold front crosses the sounds before dawn Monday morning, with water levels on the sound side potentially increasing by up to 3 ft within an hour. Oregon Inlet NC MLLW Categories - Minor 3.0 ft, Moderate 4.5 ft, Major 5.5 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 2.4 ft, Moderate 3.9 ft, Major 4.9 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 10/05 AM 1.6 1.0 1.0 1 None 10/06 PM 2.0 1.4 1.6 1-2 None 11/04 AM 3.1 2.5 2.8 2 Minor 11/06 PM 1.5 0.9 1.1 1 None 12/07 AM 1.4 0.8 0.7 1 None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
